author: balkshamster
content:
I get this error:
```
ERROR: for a340eb38df74_geth  "host" network_mode is incompatible with port_binding
```
When I run docker-compose up for the following commit:
```
Merge: 166f9cf e5eb0dc
Author: Parithosh Jayanthi <parithosh.jayanthi@ethereum.org>
Date:   Tue Dec 7 20:40:02 2021 +0100

    Merge pull request #17 from jgresham/patch-2
    
    Remove extra quotes in docker compose environment file
```

author: canbo3
content: Please check your docker image file. You need to remove the last line `network_mode: host` or the two lines starting with ports & "8545:8545"

author: errrr7609
content: Hi, I just setup Ethereum node for testing (geth + lighthouse on Ubuntu). I sent request for the 100 eth. On the block explorer I can see that I have Balance = 100 ether but on Metamask not. Is that proper behavior?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Nope it's not, can you show me the log from your geth node?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Your node is not synced, because you're running a newer version of lighthouse with an old version of geth
WARN [12-08|14:34:56.634] Served engine_executePayloadV1           conn=127.0.0.1:39468 reqid=1 t="341.817¬µs" err="invalid argument 0: missing required field 'feeRecipient' for ExecutableDataV1"
The geth version you're using is the correct one for devnet-2
But you might update it to the following branch `merge-devnet-4` so that you can join the new devnet

author: errrr7609
content: Well I checked it again but I have the newest version from merge-devnet-4 branch

author: errrr7609
content: also built once again but have same error

author: canbo3
content:
my validators are attesting properly (according to logs).
even in "Validator History" window, there are only positive balance changes.
but i see a lot of missed attestations on https://beaconchain.merge-devnet-3.wenmerge.dev/

i've also checked top validator in "Validator Leaderboard".
same problem for the top one.

author: parithosh
content:
could you check here?
https://beaconchain.devnet3.themerge.dev/

we're running a forked version of the beaconchain explorer and deployed a fix on the newer infra but left the old one alone for emergiencies.
